column4: hey, I have a usb device, but I'm unable to connect to it, how do I check to see if its working probperly
Its listed when I do "lsusb"
any chance you get a nick? :) What does lsusb say about your device?
okay, so you have a calculator that can connect to usb. and what do you do with it when it is connected to usb?
I got a program TiLP that's supposed to be able to use it...furthermore, VirtualBox is not detecting so I may attach it to a guest machien

ahah! There is special software that talks to the calculator! And.... you tried to run that software in an XP session in Vbox? But you installed the OEM Vbox from the repos, not the PUEL Vbox from Sun. So you cannot access USB from Vbox. Evar!
bing bing bing thats it bing bing bing
but first you need to uninstall what you already installed. Don't worry, your vdi doesn't need to be rebuilt.
don't I need to exporet the machines I have already?
Well, copy the .vdi out of the .virtualbox directory to be safe.
where are they located? /home?
/home/user/.virtualbox/somewhereinthere
Did it ever occur to you that the hour or three you spend making this work so you can load your calculator with finals answers, you could have just learned the material?
did you uninstall the old vbox?
its formulae you need for the tests?
anyways, you have to uninstall the version from the repos before you can install the version from SunOracle.
I did that and its still not working, I tried downloading and installing the i386 version as well and still didn't work
what OS are you installing on?
Kubuntu. Which version? Jaunty? Intrepid? Hardy?
latest (the one that came out few days ago) jaunty? (i guess)
Scroll down to where it says to add this to your sources.list file
Add the line to sources.list and then follow the remaining instructions. Do not install the .deb but instead install from apt-get. Follow those instructions
what instructions are you referring to?
The ones on this page, halfway down http://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Linux_Downloads
